name: lyss
text: I want a shirt like Todd's

name: mangtastic
text:
Just get a white tee shirt and write "THE MIRACLE" on it in permanent marker.

Also, draw in the shoulder stripes.

DIY is fun!

name: anzio
text: This is true.

name: hoarday4
text: Fuck man, we got hella Busey goin' on here....

name: hoarday4
text: One would assume this is how Todd made his in the first place. The other 45 dollars are obviously just for all the cocaine todd will snort immediately before it's his turn. He's got a pretty good chance at winning I'd bet, as long as Nice Pete isn't also an entrant.

name: jugdish
text: he just hates todd.

name: saint
text: God dammit Todd, whilst reaching into his suit coat.

name: coridoroiy
text: Ray respects Todd's office, if not the squirrel

name: utv
text: It bears repeating: Ray Smuckles is a wonderful man!

name: untilyouaresonude
text:
You're Terrible!
YOU ARE TERRIBLE!

I still yell this at my terrible friends.

name: spinynorman
text:
I had an extremely large black dude at my job who was quite humorous. One time this not-so-attractive-at-all girl came up and saw I was reading Faulkner and was like, "That's so cool!"

I was surprised, because she didn't seem to be like the kind to like Faulkner, so I said, "That's pretty neat."

"What is?" said my large friend.

"Faulkner. She likes Faulkner."

He misheard and thought I made some comment expressing the desire to fuck her. His eyes got real big and he began violently shaking his head and saying, "Why would you do that! That is terrible! It is a terrible thing! "

I immediately thought of this.

name: spinynorman
text:
Later I told her I was surprised that she liked Faulkner and she said, "Oh, I just like reading in general!"

...

name: rowboat
text: "Faulkner, Jude Devereaux, Matthew Lesko, McDonald's menus, traffic signs. Y'know, just reading!"

name: achilleselbow
text: Kinda like those people who, when asked what kind of music they like, say they "listen to everything". Which usually ends up meaning they like Dave Matthews Band and terrible radio hip-hop.

name: laserblade
text: Slathered in chubbies.  This whole thread made my day.  Fuck the Dave Matthews Band.

name: bpmead
text: Chubbied for hostility.

name: killingthejay
text: Chubbied for the mental image of Putin declaring, "Fuck the Dave Matthews Band."

name: soticoto
text: Chubbied for Atomsk-Naota dual-wielding Gibsons. Flying V in the right and EB-0 in the left.

name: clintisiceman
text: "I listen to everything! You know, Dave Matthews Band, Jack Johnson, Kanye West.....uhh....D-...Dave Matthews Band..."

name: nice-on-water
text: "I like the oldies too!  Michael Jackson...Madonna...Billy Joel but I dont no alot by him LOL!"

name: tonyhighwind
text:
There is a test to see if someone truly "listens to everything."

Play The Boredoms for them.

If they sit and listen for five minutes or more they either meant what they said, or they have respectable tenacity.

name: rowboat
text: By that standard, I do not listen to everything.

name: tonyhighwind
text:
It's really nothing to be ashamed of.

It happens to alot of guys.

name: plummet
text:
I listened to the boredoms for a half hour.

Is something wrong with me?

name: tonyhighwind
text: Probably yes, but there's something wrong with everyone so it's not a Thing.

name: diggidy
text: A comment left by diggidy was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Overmedicated, kenthegod, milkpants, ravindra108)

name: atticusonline
text: Learn 2 Drive Through.

name: gunsofray
text: have u had whoper

name: blitztrug
text: <thoughtfully fingers second Onion Offense card> :)

name: mangtastic
text: I know people like that.  One of them is a librarian.  I think she has a Condition that causes her to read any text put before her eyes.

name: rowboat
text: I'm a librarian and I never read traffic signs.

name: libelandslander
text: I am glad you don't live near me

name: soup_alex
text: Actually, I quite like to read. By this, I mean that when my immediate attention is not otherwise required (for instance walking, but most usually when passenger in a motorvehicle of some sort), I will occupy myself by reading... reading some of the most boring things ever to have been written in the history of the alphabet. Traffic signs, lorry (truck) cowlings, greengrocers's apostrophes...

name: fuzzyshoo
text: chubbied for the question mark suit reference

name: scorpio_nadir
text:
Quote:
"That's so cool!"

(What was left unsaid, therefore implied)
"that you know how to read!"

name: dondoran
text: It is depressing to me that a person would think on commenting to a person just for such as reading any old thing.  She probably likes Danielle Steele.

name: history
text: I see this line completely differently.  I think Todd knew it was a classy party and was crashing it as blackmail for the 50 bucks.  Ray is telling him he is terrible for doing so.  Todd's line in panel 7 seems somewhat threatening to me.  The whole strip seems like a negotiation.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Yeah, this sounds like it could be another Todd/Lyle con.  Basically, Ray knows that if he doesn't pay up, Todd's just gonna yell "Balls" so loud at his classy party.

name: speth
text: i don't

name: dropkickpikachu

text: "Simolean" was slang for dollar at least 50 years before SimCity came out. Sorry. At least I didn't lame you like those other heartless souls.

text: Apparently I will not learn how to spell 'philippe' until I read a few thousand more Achewood strips.

text: Cunty the Sardine?

text: same.

name: sargasm
text: Yelling "BALLS!" is hell on ankle veins

name: babachewy
text: My favorite Achewood strip. Classic Todd behavior and Ray is hilarious when he's angry.

name: zedpower
text: Todd, The Miracle of Loud Balls.

name: woodenteeth
text: Don't give him money. Don't give him anymore MONEY!

name: estutius
text: [size=20]BALLS[/size]

name: estutius
text: I guess not all BBCode tags are allowed here...

name: zem
text: it's ok, we got what you were going for

name: goosey
text: I love how it doesn't occur to Ray to just say 'no'.

name: kledermans
text: There's no fighting Todd, that only makes him more annoying.  Fifty is a small price to pay to make him get lost.

name: hateandwar
text: How wildly appropriate that you icon is Ray going "No."

name: molesticide
text: todd IS terrible

name: srennick
text: What makes it for me is that Ray is just furious, but he still goes for the wallet.  No matter that Todd's a "bullshit man," or a "crap dude."  Ray Q. Smuckles helps out a man in need.

name: kledermans
text:
Todd is up against some tough competition, having a tiny squirrel voice to begin with.

Did anyone else have the urge to scream, "BALLS!" really loudly after reading this?

Did anyone else actually do it?

name: serf
text:
this has to be todds greatest moment.

oh god that shirt. that motherfuckin shirt. it slays me every single time.

name: drskradley
text:
*goes down the street to yell "BALLS!" louder than anyone else*

One of my favourites. Ray Smuckles is a wonderful man.

name: fmercury
text: That this strip is not rated 5.0 is a travesty of justice

name: davidbowie
text: That Todd! He's so irreverent.

name: tbtabby
text: The "BALLS!" yelling contest sounds like the sort of thing you'd see on ESPN2 at 3:00 AM.

name: vandenbos
text: Right between showings of five-year old Scrabble championships and competitive chainsawing.

name: philosophe
text: Rock Paper Scissors world championships. It's real.

name: thesyndicate88
text:
The world has begun to emulate the work of Gary Larson.

I won't be worried until the chickens become restless.

name: cathaoir
text: I think he can do it. At least, he's yelled hard enough at his girlfriend that he had to be hospitalized.

name: dusty
text:
Todd: The Miracle of Loud Balls. (1998) 1hr. 39min.
A young American squirrel aspires to yell "BALLS!" louder than anyone, ever. A heartwarming and inspiring adult family comic drama.
Rated R for Fantasy Violence, intense battle sequences, Drug use, Frightening images, Blasphemy, Yelling, Balls.

name: coridoroiy
text: Fuck yes, dusty

name: dasuta
text: Can you imagine the pain that would be caused?  Screaming BALLS so hard your ankle veins bust?

name: tekende
text: I'm pretty sure all that was involved in having that shirt "made" was finding a blank T-shirt and writing "The Miracle" on it.

name: hateandwar
text: Dude, he put racing stripes on the arms.

name: direhaggis
text: Todd reminds me of Dana Carvey's character in "The Road to Wellville". All laying out the screaming of balls to get money, all needing an ankle wrap because he is downright pregnant in panels 4 and 8...

name: dusty
text: I love how it is just part of Ray's character that he can't just not give him the money. That is something Ray would never do.

name: carlyle
text: Panel three is my favorite thing. I curl up next to it at night and throw it at my foes.
